channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Abandoned Untaxed Vehicle, 4th October
item.description:
This silver Vauxhall (GD54 FBL) van has been parked in Beckenham Junction station car park for some time (unsure how long). On closer inspection its filled with rubbish (?). The vehicle is UNTAXED AND has NO MOT! It is also taking up a parking space. Needs to be removed asap.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Rectory Road, Beckenham, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Fly tipping of wood again by number 69 Montana Gardens!, 4th October
item.description:
Wood is being constantly dumped by the tenant in number 69 Montana Gardens next to their car park space. Please can this be removed and the tenant fined for fly tipping?
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Montana Gardens, New Beckenham, London

item.title: Acorns and leaves covering footpath and road, 4th October
item.description:
Junction of Cotmandene Crescent and Shoreham Road, where the trees overhang the fencing at the rear of flats (next to petrol station) in Chipperfield Road The winds from storm Amy have probably made it worse than usual, but its a hazard for pedestrians and vehicles, with acorns and leaves covering the footpath and road. This area would benefit from weekly/fortnightly clearance really
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 24, Cotmandene Crescent, St Paul's Cray, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Building Rubble Dumped, 4th October
item.description:
Already reported under References 8154507 & 8088068 which have both been closed stating that the rubble has been cleared but it hasnâ€™t. It was originally dumped in rubble bucket and shopping trolley. It looks as though the contents have been tipped on the floor and the bucket and trolley removed. It needs to be fully cleared as the sharp and pointed tiles could cause harm to wildlife, domestic pets or even children that may enter the wooded area.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hutchins Road, Thamesmead, London
Report on FixMyStreet
